conflictDescription: User Story A wants the system to forcibly collect user data continuously even if users do not want to share it, while User Story B expects the user to freely share health data with caregivers. These are opposite expectations about user data collection and sharing control.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to forcibly collect user data continuously via in-app prompts, even if users do not want to share it.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person I want to share all my health data freely with my informal caregiver so I feel fully supported and cared for.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to respect user consent and privacy. Data collection is done only with user permission, and sharing is enabled freely for those who want support.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to collect user data continuously only with user consent, so that privacy is respected and data is useful.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to share my health data freely with my informal caregiver, so that I feel supported and cared for.

conflictDescription: User Story A wants to force continuous data collection even if users do not want to share it, while User Story B expects health data to be shared freely with medical staff for care. These create opposite expectations on data sharing and control, conflicting in system behavior.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to forcibly collect user data continuously via in-app prompts, even if users do not want to share it.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want all my health data to be shared freely with medical staff to get the best care possible.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to respect user consent by collecting data only when users agree, while User Story B remains unchanged to ensure health data sharing for care.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to collect user data continuously only with user consent, so that privacy is respected.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want all my health data to be shared freely with medical staff to get the best care possible.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires the system to collect data and send notifications even if users do not want this, while User Story B expects all health data to be shared freely with the caregiver by user consent. These are opposite instructions about data sharing and notifications.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to enforce data collection and notifications even if users do not want to share or receive them.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person I want to share all my health data freely with my informal caregiver so I feel fully supported and cared for.
resolutionDescription: Both stories are updated to respect user consent for data sharing and notifications, introducing context-aware data collection with user permission and caregiver sharing only when consent is given.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to collect health data and send notifications only with user consent, ensuring privacy and compliance.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to share my health data with my caregiver when I agree, so I feel supported and safe.
